13/*
14 * Edit option information. Historically, if you set a boolean or numeric
15 * edit option value to its "default" value, it didn't show up in the :set
16 * display, i.e. it wasn't considered "changed". String edit options would
17 * show up as changed, regardless. We maintain a parallel set of values
18 * which are the default values and never consider an edit option changed
19 * if it was reset to the default value.
20 *
21 * Macros to retrieve boolean, integral and string option values, and to
22 * set, clear and test boolean option values. Some options (secure, lines,
23 * columns, terminal type) are global in scope, and are therefore stored
24 * in the global area. The offset in the global options array is stored
25 * in the screen's value field. This is set up when the options are first
26 * initialized.
27 */
28#define O_V(sp, o, fld) \
29 (F_ISSET(&(sp)->opts[(o)], OPT_GLOBAL) ? \
30 (sp)->gp->opts[(sp)->opts[(o)].o_cur.val].fld : \
31 (sp)->opts[(o)].fld)
32
33/* Global option macros. */
34#define OG_CLR(gp, o) ((gp)->opts[(o)].o_cur.val) = 0
35#define OG_SET(gp, o) ((gp)->opts[(o)].o_cur.val) = 1
36#define OG_STR(gp, o) ((gp)->opts[(o)].o_cur.str)
37#define OG_VAL(gp, o) ((gp)->opts[(o)].o_cur.val)
38#define OG_ISSET(gp, o) OG_VAL(gp, o)
39
40#define OG_D_STR(gp, o) ((gp)->opts[(o)].o_def.str)
41#define OG_D_VAL(gp, o) ((gp)->opts[(o)].o_def.val)
42
43/*
44 * Flags to o_set(); need explicit OS_STR as can be setting the value to
45 * NULL.
46 */
47#define OS_DEF 0x01 /* Set the default value. */
48#define OS_NOFREE 0x02 /* Don't free the old string. */
49#define OS_STR 0x04 /* Set to string argument. */
50#define OS_STRDUP 0x08 /* Copy then set to string argument. */
51
52struct _option {
53 union {
54 u_long val; /* Value or boolean. */
55 const char *str; /* String. */
56 } o_cur;
57#define O_CLR(sp, o) o_set(sp, o, 0, NULL, 0)
58#define O_SET(sp, o) o_set(sp, o, 0, NULL, 1)
59#define O_STR(sp, o) O_V(sp, o, o_cur.str)
60#define O_VAL(sp, o) O_V(sp, o, o_cur.val)
61#define O_ISSET(sp, o) O_VAL(sp, o)
62
63 union {
64 u_long val; /* Value or boolean. */
65 const char *str; /* String. */
66 } o_def;
67#define O_D_CLR(sp, o) o_set(sp, o, OS_DEF, NULL, 0)
68#define O_D_SET(sp, o) o_set(sp, o, OS_DEF, NULL, 1)
69#define O_D_STR(sp, o) O_V(sp, o, o_def.str)
70#define O_D_VAL(sp, o) O_V(sp, o, o_def.val)
71#define O_D_ISSET(sp, o) O_D_VAL(sp, o)
72
73#define OPT_GLOBAL 0x01 /* Option is global. */
74#define OPT_SELECTED 0x02 /* Selected for display. */
75 u_int8_t flags;
76};
77
78/* List of option names, associated update functions and information. */
79struct _optlist {
80 const CHAR_T *name; /* Name. */
81 /* Change function. */
82 int (*func) __P((SCR *, OPTION *, const char *, u_long *));
83 /* Type of object. */
84 enum { OPT_0BOOL, OPT_1BOOL, OPT_NUM, OPT_STR } type;
85
86#define OPT_ADISP 0x001 /* Always display the option. */
87#define OPT_ALWAYS 0x002 /* Always call the support function. */
88#define OPT_NDISP 0x004 /* Never display the option. */
89#define OPT_NOSAVE 0x008 /* Mkexrc command doesn't save. */
90#define OPT_NOSET 0x010 /* Option may not be set. */
91#define OPT_NOUNSET 0x020 /* Option may not be unset. */
92#define OPT_NOZERO 0x040 /* Option may not be set to 0. */
93#define OPT_PAIRS 0x080 /* String with even length */
94 u_int8_t flags;
95};
96
97/* Option argument to opts_dump(). */
98enum optdisp { NO_DISPLAY, ALL_DISPLAY, CHANGED_DISPLAY, SELECT_DISPLAY };
99
100/* Options array. */
101extern OPTLIST const optlist[];
102
103#include "options_def.h"
104
